topics.title: Plows 101
topics.teaser: Trip-edge vs full-trip, sizing, and when to add wings or underbody.

qas.q: Trip-edge vs full-trip: what's the difference?
qas.a: Trip-edge trips at the cutting edge to absorb obstacles while keeping the load. Full-trip pivots the whole moldboard to soften impacts at speed.

qas.q: Straight, V, or Wing—when to choose which?
qas.a: Straight for versatility; V to break drifts and switch modes; Wing to increase cleared width per pass alongside a front plow.

qas.q: How do I size moldboard width/height?
qas.a: Match to lane width/turning envelope; confirm coverage at typical plow angles; balance height for sightlines vs blow-back control.

qas.q: Which cutting edge material should I use?
qas.a: Steel for general durability; rubber/poly for surface sensitivity; carbide inserts for maximum wear life on abrasive routes.

quickWins: Verify legal width at working angle.
